definition: confrontation of 1929 between Chiang Kaishek and the Guangxi warlord faction
surname Jiang/refers to Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石
surname Gui/abbr. for Guangxi Autonomous Region 廣西壯族自治區|广西壮族自治区[Guang3 xi1 Zhuang4 zu2 Zi4 zhi4 qu1]
cassia/laurel
to fight/fight/war/battle
to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)
Guangxi warlord faction, from 1911-1930
National protection war or Campaign to defend the republic (1915), a rebellion against the installation of Yuan Shikai as emperor
war of 1920 between Northern Warlords, in which the Zhili faction beat the Anhui faction and took over the Beijing government
Lu Rongting (1858-1928), provincial governor of Guangxi under the Qing, subsequently leader of old Guangxi warlord faction
Chen Jiongming (1878-1933), a leading warlord of Guangdong faction, defeated in 1925 and fled to Hong Kong
second revolution/campaign from 1913 of the provisional revolutionary government (under Sun Yat-sen and the Guomindang) against Yuan Shikai 袁世凱|袁世凯 and the Northern Warlords
Bai Chongxi (1893-1966), a leader of Guangxi warlord faction, top Nationalist general, played important role in Chiang Kaishek's campaigns 1926-1949
the Northern Expeditionary Army
opposing Yuan Shikai 袁世凱|袁世凯 in War of national protection 1915-1916/same as 反袁鬥爭|反袁斗争
purge of the party
Li Zongren (1891-1969), a leader of Guangxi warlord faction
National Protection War or Campaign to Defend the Republic (1915), a rebellion against the installation of Yuan Shikai 袁世凱|袁世凯[Yuan2 Shi4 kai3] as emperor
United Front (either of the two alliances between the Guomindang and the Communist Party, 1923-1927 and 1937-1945)
Fengtian clique (of northern warlords)
New Fourth Army Incident of 1940, involving fighting between the Nationalists and Communists
Chiang Kai-shek (1887-1975), military leader, head of the Nationalist government in China 1928-1949 and the government in exile on Taiwan 1950-1975
